intro: Peucedanum circumdatum, commonly known as the Persian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbrella-shaped clusters. It is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and can thrive in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
